abstract: A gesture that provides information about ongoing spatial events like clicks and touches.
overview:
## Overview

Use a gesture of this type to track multiple simultaneous spatial events and gain access to detailed information about each. For example, you can place a particle emitter at every location in a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Canvas] that has an ongoing spatial event:

The gesture provides a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/SpatialEventCollection] structure when it detects changes. The collection contains [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/SpatialEventCollection/Event] values that represent ongoing spatial events. Each event contains a stable, unique identifier so that you can track how the event changes over time. The event also indicates its current location, a timestamp, the pose of the input device that creates it, and other useful information.

The phase of events in the collection can change to [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/SpatialEventCollection/Event/Phase-swift.enum/ended] or [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/SpatialEventCollection/Event/Phase-swift.enum/cancelled] while the gesture itself remains active. Individually track state for each event inside [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Gesture/onChanged(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Gesture/updating(_:body:)] and clean up all state in [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Gesture/onEnded(_:)].
